com.ojcoleman.ahni.util

Class Parallel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.util.Parallel

  • public class Parallel
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for performing parallel iteration over generic Collections or anything that implements the Iterable interface. Code adapted from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4010185/parallel-for-for-java#4010275

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Parallel.Operation<T>
      An operation to be performed on a single element.

    • Constructor Summary

      Parallel()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parallel

        public Parallel()

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultThreads

        public static void setDefaultThreads(int mt)
        Sets the default number of threads that will be used. Calls to the forEach(...) methods made prior to calling this method will not be affected. The default number of threads is initially set to Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors().

      • foreach

        public static <T> void foreach(java.util.Collection<T> elements,
               int threads,
               Parallel.Operation<T> operation)
        Perform the given Parallel.Operation on the given elements. Returns when all elements have been processed.
        Parameters:
        elements - The Collection of elements to apply the operation to.
        threads - The number of threads to use. If set to 0 then the default number will be used.
        operation - The operation to apply to each element.

      • foreach

        public static <T> void foreach(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements,
               int threads,
               Parallel.Operation<T> operation)
        Perform the given Parallel.Operation on the given elements. Returns when all elements have been processed.
        Parameters:
        elements - An Iterator over elements to apply the operation to.
        threads - The number of threads to use. If set to 0 then the default number will be used.
        operation - The operation to apply to each element.
